FuncDef:
The e-trunk mode command configures a working mode for an Eth-Trunk interface in an E-Trunk.
The undo e-trunk mode command restores the working mode of an Eth-Trunk interface in an E-Trunk.
By default, an Eth-Trunk interface works in automatic mode in an E-Trunk.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the mode.
auto:Indicates the automatic mode.
force-master:Indicates the master mode.
force-backup:Indicates the backup mode.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If an Eth-Trunk interface in an E-Trunk works in automatic mode or is switched to the automatic mode from the forcible master or backup mode, the master/backup status of the Eth-Trunk interface is determined by the master/backup status of the local E-Trunk and the peer member interface status.
If the local E-Trunk works in master mode, the local Eth-Trunk interface also works in master mode.If the local E-Trunk works in backup mode and the peer Eth-Trunk interface is faulty, the local Eth-Trunk interface works in master mode. When the local Eth-Trunk interface receives a message indicating recovery of the peer Eth-Trunk interface, the local Eth-Trunk interface works in backup mode.

Precautions
The e-trunk mode command can only be run on an Eth-Trunk interface added to an E-Trunk. If the Eth-Trunk interface is deleted from the E-Trunk, the command configuration is cleared automatically.
When Eth-Trunk interfaces in an E-Trunk work in automatic mode, a change in the interval at which Hello packets are sent will result in the master/backup status flapping. Configure the Eth-Trunk interfaces to work in master/backup mode before changing the interval at which Hello packets are sent. Restore the Eth-Trunk interfaces to the automatic mode after the negotiation is completed.
In an interface extension scenario, if an existing extension interface has been added to an Eth-Trunk interface, the e-trunk mode command fails to be run in the Eth-Trunk interface view. To run this command in the interface view, delete the extension interface from the Eth-Trunk interface first.
